p: The interviews were followed by the collection of plants under the supervision of three traditional healers. Seventy medicinal plants were documented from the survey (Supplementary Material- Table S1). Forty of these, cited more than five times by 20% of the traditional healers, were collected from the Ejisu-Juaben district for further investigation. They were authenticated by Dr. George Henry Sam of the Department of Herbal Medicine. Voucher specimens of all the plants have been deposited in the Herbarium of the Herbal Medicine Department, Faculty of Pharmacy & Pharmaceutical Sciences, KNUST, with defined ID numbers. The names and the authenticity of the plant species were confirmed using the Electronic Plant Information Centre (ePIC, http://epic.kew.org/).
